text: Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aorma has notes of butter, malt, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of cardboard, malt, and straw. The body is light.

Bottle. Pale golden with a white head leaving some lacing. Aroma: sweet malt, fresh citrus hoppiness. Taste: very fruity, citrus, grass, cookies (mördeg), fresh, low bitterness. The taste is a bit thin, I guess that is unavoidable. Light-bodied and thin with medium carbonation. Riktigt bra folkis!

Bottle at Papsø.
Clear golden colorued with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, hops and ashtray.
Malty flavour of caramel, hops, ashtray and grass.
Bitter finish.
50 cL bottle. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is slight herbal, citrusy and light grassy. Bitter, herbal and grassy. Light butterish impression. Ends dry and bitter. Light herbal.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear yellow with a strange reddish tint and a small white head. Malty nose with a diacetyl touch. Light body, dry and dusty, somewhat fruity, a little cardboard. Dry and somewhat hoppy finish. I guess its hard to brew an unflawed Low Acohol on a small brewery. 100511

Bottle 500ml.Clear medium yellow color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, light to moderate hoppy, citrus, lemon. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, peel bitter, thin - watered. Body is light medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20110212]

50cL bottle, courtesy of blomster. Thanks, Christer! Really excited to try this and the other 2.8% beer he brought over. Pours a bright, medium golden-straw color; high clarity; thin, fine-bubbled white head with light retention and lacing. Soft, rounded presence of Maris Otter malts in the aroma, along with a very light citrus hoppiness; balanced and crisp; the malt aromas pop, and the whole effect is a touch like fresh tea. Light to medium-light body; pretty high carbonation. Really nice presentation in the mouth, with only a touch of wateriness (generally filled out); modest levels of, again, Maris Otter maltiness and some zesty citrus and earthy hop bitterness and flavor (more pronounced than the aroma hints at); a touch of a crystalline sugar character, along with a slight tea-like texture that remains non-astringent; some really nice, well-integrated hop flavor comes through: citrus, floral notes. Hugely drinkable, and well handled. Medium-length finish showing pronounced toastiness and a bit of citrus bitterness lingering; nicely dry. I could drink this all day.

bottle(thanks to Blomster) at my leaving FL throwdown(17Dec10)pours bright yellow with a medium white pillow of a head.  Aroma is grassy malts and hops, very earthy and fresh smelling.  Flavor is thin, but for a low alcohol beer this has surprisingly good flavor.  Grassy grains, straw and dried grass with clean almost peppery hops.

12/17/10.  Bottle shared by fata2683 - thanks, Keith!  Clear, bright yellow pour with a small white head.  Aroma is pilsner malt and a dash of sour hops.  Surprisingly bitter flavor that reeks of pilsner malt and a bit of sour hops.
First low alcohol beer, thanks to Keith, little to no hop character, watery, malt, dough, actually refreshing. Quite good.

Bottled 500ml (BB 12/2010)
Hazy murky yellow color, huge white head. Odd sweety, dirty socks, grainy and hoppy nose. Light body. Kind of plastic mouthfeel, flowery hoppy, perfumic. Nice low alcohol beer, but low alcohol is low alcohol ...
Bottled (thanks gnoff). Golden colour, big white head. Aroma is extreme floral hops with some mild breadyness. Flavour is fruity and floral hops along with some mild bready malts.
Bottle (Stockholm Beer Festival 2010) - Gold/amber in colour. Hoppy aroma with tea and grapefruit detected. Slightly soapy taste with grapefruit, hops and malt.
Bottle at Bishops Arms, Gustav Adolfs Torg, Malmø. Clear yellow - white head. Nice hoppy, light malty, citrus, straw, hay, dry hoppy, nice light bitterness.
Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter flavor with some weak caramel hints. Has a dry malty hoppy finish.
Somewhat hazy pale golden color, big white head. Citrus aroma, floral notes, perfume. Hoppy grassy flavor, rather bitter. Some citrus, perfume notes. Rather bitter metallic finish.

Bottled from Ica Maxi
Golden, slightly hazy with a large, white head.
Perfume-ish aroma with fruity notes.
Flowery flavour with citrus and flowers.
Medium, late, dry, grassy bitterness.
Aroma is hoppy and hay. Taste is fizzy, balanced, surprisingly thick body with real bitterness at the end.

50 c bottle from ICA Maxi, MölndalBB 2010-12-08, tried on August 26, 2010Clear golden color, fluffy white lasting head. Nice fresh, sweet, hoppy, fruity, floral, goose berry scent. Malty, dry, thinish, grainy, harsh, fruity, hoppy taste. One of the better 2.8% Swedish beers Ive tasted for sure. Still could have sweeter taste, or rather more residual sweetness, for my personal taste hat is. A bit under medium mouthfeel, though more than OK fo this low alcohol. Not going even close to thin. Medium bitterness, though to the dry side. Fruity and dry, mineral like, aftertaste.Get it while you can!

Bottled, thanks gnoff!  Almost clear golden, brief head. Distinct spicy hop aroma with hay, orange and grapefruit. Dr and light bodied with soft, rounded mouthfeel. Despite being 2.8% its nowhere near thin, just freshening, hoppy and well balanced. An excellent 2.8% beer!.

Bottle. Pale yellow colour with a lasting white head. Pale malt, grass, a very light fruitiness, lemon, a bit of white bread, popcorn, rather bitter finish. Light bodied and dry. A bit lagerlike. Very good "folköl".

Bottle from ICA Maxi Mölndal, 2010-08-06, Göteborg
AR (sniffing the bottle): lovely tropical fruits, scotch fudge
AP: hay yellow, high big bobbly/creamy white head
F: dry hoppiness, medium + bitterness, the fruits from the aroma are gone, wee sweetness, well brewed low alcoholic beer from Göteborg!

Bottle (50 cl) from ICA Maxi, Mölndal, Sweden. Clear golden, small white head. Earthy and slightly weak malt aroma, with grassy, floral, and herbal hops. Light in body, low carbonation. Dry with firm bitterness, a bit too much for such a light beer. Still, a good low alcohol thirst quencher.
